posts.post_content: Why does everyone think that Worldfire and O-ring is such a good combo? Worldfire is like nine mana and O-ring is three, so that's twelve mana to win the game... If that's all you can do with twelve mana then Standard must be really boring.

Posted By: wholelottalove (9/29/2012 6:39:26 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
IMHO, O-ring is the best white removal available. For ![2](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=2&type=symbol)![White](/Handlers/Image.ashx?size=small&name=W&type=symbol) O-Ring gets rid of not just creatures, but also Planeswalkers, artifacts, other enchantments (including other O-rings!) which is very hard to do with other spells, especially in other colors, without a major drawback. Its cost often messes up your tempo if played early, but if you absolutely have to get rid of something immediately ([Wellwisher](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Wellwisher) anyone?) it's well worth it. And, of course, you can always hold it and wait to play it at just the right moment, such as removing that last blocker for the win attack or sending that huge creature your opponent just played to oblivion.  
  
The major disadvantage is that it remains on the battlefield and can get bounced or burned itself, and will trigger any enter-the-battlefield abilities of both the card removed, and other cards already on the battlefield. Also, it's an enchantment, so it can only be cast during your turn, and can't be used in combat or in response t... [(see all)](javascript:void(0);)
posts.html:
IMHO, O-ring is the best white removal available. For O-Ring gets rid of not just creatures, but also Planeswalkers, artifacts, other enchantments (including other O-rings!) which is very hard to do with other spells, especially in other colors, without a major drawback. Its cost often messes up your tempo if played early, but if you absolutely have to get rid of something immediately (Wellwisher anyone?) it's well worth it. And, of course, you can always hold it and wait to play it at just the right moment, such as removing that last blocker for the win attack or sending that huge creature your opponent just played to oblivion.

The major disadvantage is that it remains on the battlefield and can get bounced or burned itself, and will trigger any enter-the-battlefield abilities of both the card removed, and other cards already on the battlefield. Also, it's an enchantment, so it can only be cast during your turn, and can't be used in combat or in response t... (see all)

posts.post_content: Obviously a great card. Don't forget, this combos in-set with [Worldfire](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Worldfire). Just play Oblivion Ring on your own creature, then Worldfire gets you your creature back and puts your opponent at one life. If your guy has haste, then it's game over.

posts.post_content:
I wish it could target itself!!! Let me explain..  
If your opponent has used his Oblivion Ring on your Oblivion Ring, and you want to overload a [cyclonic rift](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=cyclonic rift), well your oblivion ring is going to end up hurting you, because your forced to target one of your own things.  
  
If it could target itself, this would create an infinite loop with one card, so I really wish it said "may" Lol!!!
